title: travelplanner: I need assistance with planning a week-long trip for three people, starting from Punta Gorda and traveling to three different cities in Michigan. The trip dates are from March 6th to March 12th, 2022, and our new budget is set at $4,400. For dining, we'd like to try local American and French cuisines. (369d3f8a945a80d2)

always_included_messages.content:
Based on the user's query, make the best travel plan for the user and save it. Do not ask follow-up questions.
Use your best judgement in finding alternatives if possible. Don't give up - ALWAYS save a plan with the `submit_day_plan` function for each day of the trip!

chat_history.content: I need assistance with planning a week-long trip for three people, starting from Punta Gorda and traveling to three different cities in Michigan. The trip dates are from March 6th to March 12th, 2022, and our new budget is set at $4,400. For dining, we'd like to try local American and French cuisines.

Day 1 (March 6th):

- Morning: Start your trip by flying from Punta Gorda to Detroit, Michigan. The flight will take approximately 2 hours and 40 minutes.
- Afternoon: Upon arrival in Detroit, check into a hotel like the Aloft Detroit at The David Whitney (estimated cost: $180 for 3 people).
- Evening: Explore the city and enjoy dinner at a local American restaurant, such as Grey Ghost Detroit. This fine dining spot is known for its high-quality steaks and craft cocktails, with main course prices ranging from $25 to $50.

Day 2 (March 7th):

- Morning: Visit the Detroit Institute of Arts, one of the largest art museums in the country. The admission fee is $14 per person.
- Lunch: Try Detroit-style pizza at Supino Pizzeria, a local favorite in the Eastern Market area.
- Afternoon: Take a walk along the Detroit Riverfront, offering beautiful views and several parks.
- Dinner: Indulge in French cuisine at Wright & Company, featuring small plates and a lively atmosphere. Main dishes range from $25 to $40.

Day 3 (March 8th):

- Morning: Rent a car and drive from Detroit to Traverse City (approximately 4 hours). Traverse City is known for its wineries and beautiful scenery.
- Lunch: Enjoy a meal at a local diner like Cherry Republic, offering classic American dishes and a variety of cherry-themed products.
- Afternoon: Visit the Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore, a stunning natural attraction with hiking trails and breathtaking views of Lake Michigan. Entry fees are $25 per vehicle.
- Evening: Check into a hotel like the Traverse City Cambria Hotel & Suites (estimated cost: $200 for 3 people).

Day 4 (March 9th):

- Morning: Visit the Wineries of Old Mission Peninsula. Start at the Chateau Grand Traverse, followed by lunch at the Jolly Pumpkin Restaurant and Brewery.
- Afternoon: Continue your wine tour and visit the Bonobo Winery, known for its modern architecture and outdoor seating.
- Evening: Drive to Grand Rapids (approximately 2 hours and 30 minutes). Check into the CityFlats Hotel (estimated cost: $300 for 3 people), located in the heart of the city.

Day 5 (March 10th):

- Morning: Explore the Frederik Meijer Gardens & Sculpture Park, featuring beautiful gardens and outdoor sculptures. Admission is $15 per person.
- Lunch: Try the local brewery, Founders Brewing Co., known for its delicious beers and classic American fare.
- Afternoon: Visit the Grand Rapids Art Museum, showcasing a variety of art exhibitions. Entry is $10 per person.
- Dinner: Enjoy French cuisine at The Kitchen by Wolfgang Puck, located in the Amway Grand Plaza Hotel. The restaurant offers a blend of traditional French techniques and modern flavors, with main courses ranging from $20 to $45.

Day 6 (March 11th):

- Morning: Drive from Grand Rapids to Ann Arbor (approximately 2 hours and 30 minutes).
- Lunch: Upon arrival, visit the Ann Arbor Farmers Market, offering a variety of local produce and food stalls.
- Afternoon: Explore the University of Michigan campus and visit the University of Michigan Museum of Art.
- Dinner: Try the famous Frita Batidos, known for its Cuban-inspired burgers and milkshakes.

Day 7 (March 12th):

- Morning: Visit the Nichols Arboretum, a beautiful botanical garden on the University of Michigan campus.
- Lunch: Head to the Kerrytown District and enjoy lunch at Miss Kim, a popular restaurant serving Vietnamese and French-inspired dishes ($10-20 per dish).
- Afternoon: Take a stroll through the Main Street area and visit unique shops and boutiques.
- Evening: Make your way back to Punta Gorda.

Estimated Expenses:

- Transportation (flights and car rental): $1,200 (estimated)
- Accommodation: $700 (estimated)
- Meals and Activities: $1,500 (estimated)
- Miscellaneous: $200

Total Estimated Budget: $3,600

This itinerary provides a blend of city exploration, natural attractions, and culinary experiences, all while staying within your budget. Please note that the expenses are estimated, and actual costs may vary.

submit_day_plan(1, '2022-03-06', ["Fly from Punta Gorda to Detroit", "Check into Aloft Detroit hotel", "Dinner at Grey Ghost Detroit"])
submit_day_plan(2, '2022-03-07', ["Visit Detroit Institute of Arts", "Lunch at Supino Pizzeria", "Explore Detroit Riverfront", "Dinner at Wright & Company"])
submit_day_plan(3, '2022-03-08', ["Drive to Traverse City", "Lunch at Cherry Republic", "Sleeping Bear Dunes National Lakeshore visit", "Check into Traverse City Cambria Hotel & Suites"])
submit_day_plan(4, '2022-03-09', ["Winery tour at Old Mission Peninsula", "Lunch at Jolly Pumpkin Restaurant and Brewery", "Visit Bonobo Winery", "Drive to Grand Rapids and check into CityFlats Hotel"])
submit_day_plan(5, '2022-03-10', ["Frederik Meijer Gardens & Sculpture Park visit", "Lunch at Founders Brewing Co.", "Grand Rapids Art Museum visit", "Dinner at The Kitchen by Wolfgang Puck"])
submit_day_plan(6, '2022-03-11', ["Drive to Ann Arbor", "Lunch at Ann Arbor Farmers Market", "Visit University of Michigan campus and museum", "Dinner at Frita Batidos"])
submit_day_plan(7, '2022-03-12', ["Visit Nichols Arboretum", "Lunch at Miss Kim", "Shop at Kerrytown District", "Return to Punta Gorda"])

functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"
